messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Need help with figuring out where i went horribly...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/15/2005 10:40:59 AM Central Standard Time, de_perri@yahoo.com writes: I sat  with him on the couch and held him and listened to him and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/15/2005 10:40:59 AM Central Standard Time,
de_perri@... writes:

I sat with him on the
couch and held him and listened to him and he told me how he was feeling and
I listened
and gave him hugs and kisses. After he was in a calmner space, i started
talking wiht him
about what his options were-of either our room or his and which did he want
but he got
really upset again.


~~~
Why can't he sleep on the couch? Why is it either your room or his?

I always turned the lights down and got the house quiet and stayed on the
couch or wherever was comfortable for the little one to be until he had enough
and snuggled in with me.

Why don't you just sleep on the couch with him? Or sleep on the couch while
he's playing nearby.

Karen


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
